New Records: Lionel Messi scored his 14th goal in this Copa América edition and his 109th goal in 186 caps for Argentina.
Key Match Events: Lionel Messi scored the decisive goal in the 51st minute to seal Argentina's victory.
Julián Álvarez scored the first goal for Argentina in the 22nd minute.
Canada had several promising attacks but couldn't convert chances.
Pre-Game Insights: Canada entered the match as underdogs but had a strong performance and progress under coach Jesse Marsch.
Post-Match Reflections: Argentina showed improvement from their quarter-final win against Ecuador, where Emi Martínez was crucial in a penalty shootout.
Lionel Messi's fitness concerns were alleviated by completing the full 90 minutes.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at a hot and humid MetLife Stadium.
Canada's progress was a testament to their rapid development under coach Jesse Marsch.
